The goal for today is to calculate a PCA model. First, let's load our packages:

```{r Setup, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

# Load tidyverse and lavaan packages
library(tidyverse)
library(psych)
library(GPArotation)

# CFA testing
library(lavaan)
```

Let's load in some data:

```{r Data}
data <- read.csv("https://uoepsy.github.io/data/conduct_probs.csv")
str(data)

data <- data %>%
  select(item1:item10)
```

Let's run a Tucker's congruence coefficient to see the difference between the two solutions:

```{r}
# Estimate different types of models
fa_orthog <- fa(data, nfactors = 2, fml = "ml", rotate = "varimax")
fa_oblique <- fa(data, nfactors = 2, fm = "ml", rotate = "oblimin")

fa_oblique

fa.congruence(fa_orthog, fa_oblique)
```

Reliability testing:

```{r}
# Cronbach's Alpha
data %>% 
  select(item1:item5) %>%
  alpha()

# McDonald's Omega
data %>% 
  select(item1:item5) %>%
  omega()
```

Let's score them up:

```{r}
# Extract sum scores
data <- data %>%
  rowwise() %>%
  mutate(score1 = mean(item1:item5),
         score2 = mean(item6:item10))

# Extract factor scores
scores <- fa_oblique$scores

# View the data
head(data)
```

Construct validity / criterion validity:

```{r}
cor(data$score1,
    data$score2)
```

## Optional

Let's test a confirmatory factor analysis model:

```{r}
cfa_spec <- '
# Factors
f1 =~ item6 + item7 + item8 + item9 + item10
f2 =~ item1 + item2 + item3 + item 4 + item5

# Paths
f1 ~ f2
'

cfa_mod <- cfa(model = cfa_spec, data = data)

summary(cfa_mod,
        fit.measures = T,
        ci = T,
        std = T,
        modindices = T)
```
